intro: Hieracium microcomum, commonly known as the small-headed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring moist to dry conditions. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are usually hairy and alternate along the stem. Hieracium microcomum is often found in open habitats and can be a common weed in agricultural areas.
